result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof,and any week defendant does not obtain that status, he must perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with A.A.C. of any type.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
If defendant succesfully completes probation and obtains no new criminal charges, he may petition the court for expungement.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:26am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/pro se and with Atty Amanda Ley.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Sex w/Child Age 16 or older)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Sex w/Child Age 16 or older)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1  year probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with victim A.A.C. of any type; Obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, and any week defendant does not obtain that status, he must perform 10 hours of c.s./week; CC.

>>If defendant successfully completes probation and obtains no new criminal charges, he may petition the court for expungement.
State notes restitution requested by victim but is not allowable, and therefore no restitution requested.

Adj: 11:32am
Plea hearing on May 28, 2015 at 11:20 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:51pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant does not appear - Attorney Amanda Ley appears on his behalf.

Atty Ley states defendant is at home in Marshfield at this time as he forgot about hearing today; Parties have agreement.
COURT directs parties to reset this matter for later this week.

Bond continues.

Adj: 1:54pm
Plea hearing on May 26, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Attorney Ley may submit an adjournment request

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:38am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Amanda Ley.


Parties note agreement has NOT been reached in this matter; Defendant is awaiting further charges arising out of the same incident.
COURT questions parties as to discovery and if any motions will be filed before trial; Parties not discovery completed.

COURT leaves JT date on court's calendar - Atty Ley requests defendant be available by phone for FPT date -- COURT grants.
Bond continues.

Adj: 8:40am
Plea hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on February 25, 2015 at 10:55 am.
Plea hearing on March 25, 2015 at 11:50 am.
Final pre-trial on April 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Jury Trial on April 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No contact with victim(s):  A.A.C.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
